  • Method Details

    • getInstructions

      protected List<edu.knox.knoxcraftmod.client.TerpInstruction> getInstructions()

    • setBlock

      public void setBlock(TerpBlockType terpBlockType)
      Set the given block type at the Terp's current location.
      Parameters:
      terpBlockType -

    • forward

      public void forward()
      Move the Terp forward one block.

    • back

      public void back()
      Move the Terp back one block.

    • turnLeft

      public void turnLeft()
      Turn the Terp left. The Terp will stay at the current block.

    • turnRight

      public void turnRight()
      Turn the Terp right. The Terp wil stay at the current block.

    • left

      public void left()
      Move the Terp one block to the left.

    • right

      public void right()
      Move the Terp one block to the right.

    • up

      public void up()
      Move the Terp up one block. The Terp cannot move up above the max height of the server.

    • down

      public void down()
      Move the Terp down one block. The Terp cannot move below the ground level, which is -60 on modern Minecraft servers.

    • nop

      public void nop()
      No operation. The Terp sits there for 1 tick and does nothing. Nops allow threads to be paused should parallel programs want to line up and synchronize their threads.

    • add

      protected void add(edu.knox.knoxcraftmod.client.TerpCommand cmd)
